Prime Minister Andrew Holness yesterday put parents and school administrators on notice that face-to-face learning will resume for 376 of the island's 759 primary schools on November 8. This will see the return of 45,390 students to classrooms for some level of physical learning weekly.    One hundred and ninety-one, or half of the selected schools are small primary schools with enrolment of less than 100 students.
